1.description: Introduction to the lab and overview of objectives.
1.directions: You have a organic product mixture. Your aim is to extract the final product from the mixture.

2.description: Setting up the necessary apparatus for liquid-liquid extraction.
2.directions: First, take out all the apparatus and chemicals needed for the lab from the cabinet.

3.description: Pouring the organic product mixture into a separating funnel.
3.directions: Pour the organic product mixture into a separating funnel.

4.description: Pouring water into the separating funnel and observing layer formation.
4.directions: Next, pour the water into the separating funnel. Notice, two layers are formed due to immiscibility. In this case, the organic layer is on the top as it has a lower density than the bottom aqueous layer.

5.description: Securing the separating funnel with a stopper.

6.description: Inverting the funnel and venting it to release pressure.
6.directions: Slowly invert the funnel and open the stopcock to vent.
6.user_instructions: Click on the stopcock to open it.

7.description: Mixing the liquids by shaking the separating funnel.
7.directions: After you close the stopcock, gently shake the separating funnel to mix the liquid well.
7.user_instructions: Click on the funnel to shake it.

8.description: Opening the stopcock again to vent after shaking.
8.directions: After shaking, open the stopcock again to vent. Then close the stopcock.
8.user_instructions: Click on the stopcock to vent.

9.description: Waiting for the liquid layers to separate completely.
9.directions: Let the mixture set until two layers separated completely.

10.description: Removing the bottom layer and repeating the washing process.
10.directions: Remove the stopper, drain all the aqueous layer into a beaker. Then, repeat the washing process for 2-3 times.

11.description: Transferring the organic layer into a new beaker.
11.directions: After washing and draining the aqueous layer, pour the organic layer from the top into a new beaker.
11.user_instructions: Click the separating funnel to pour organic layer to beaker.

12.description: Adding anhydrous magnesium sulfate to the organic layer.
12.directions: Add anhydrous magnesium sulfate to absorb the remaining moisture. Swirl well. Add until the magnesium sulfate powder does not stick together and completely separated.

13.description: Filtering away the solid to purify the product.
13.user_instructions: Click the beaker with the organic solution to filter it.

14.directions: Congratulations! You have finished the lab, as the purified organic product is now obtained.
